channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rotten fencing. M5 Southbound between junc11 and junc11a at WOODHOUSE farm., 29th December
item.description:
The motorway fence is totally rotted and falling over. I’ve used my own stakes and tied it up in places. We have cattle and sheep and this should have been dealt with as routine maintenance. This is the second time I’ve reported it. It’s against fields just north of WOODHOUSE Farm on the southbound side of M5. GL34RD. Feel free to inspect from the farm side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many potholes on uphill side of road, 29th December
item.description:
The potholes on the uphill side of the road are truly awful for those on motorbikes. It’s very dangerous when wet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards lights not working at night., 28th December
item.description:
These bollards' lights have not been working for a while and it will cause an accident as they are invisible at night. Me and my wife have almost hit them on separate occasions. You can't see them until it's too late.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Grasson GOTHERINGTON, Gotherington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Not workinf
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Dunalley Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Eroded Passing Places along the Cleeve Common Road, 27th December
item.description:
Starting from the Burnt Oak Crossroads and all the way to the Pylons Carpark along the Cleeve Common Road - places for vehicles to pass which means at least one has to move off the highway have been heavily eroded in places to the extent that bottoming out could occur. A meeting with Highways last year was advised that this would be rectified at the end of 2021 - but hardly anything has been done in particualr areas which really only needs a harcore application rather than tarmac being applied. Please can the areas along the roads be treated ahead of what is usually bad weather in January to April.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small amount of Fly Tipped Material at Location, 27th December
item.description:
The location is the entrance to the Old Quarry off of the Cleeve Common Road. Material in a polythene bag has been tipped there and there is more behind the wall of the entrance. Please can it be removed as soon as possible as it is being scattered about
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: About 100 to 250 Gordons gin and tonic tins under the tree on the corner of Goldsmith and Shakespeare, 23rd December
item.description:
I flagged this before but they seem to have just taken the ones they could see. Perhaps the green spaces team needs to get involved and cut back the bushes so that the litter can be retrieved?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 63 Shakespeare Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Roundabout not wide enough, 21st December
item.description:
I'm not sure who works out the measurements for these new roundabouts, but they definitely aren't big enough. The roundabout has two lanes to enter the roundabout but it's not wide enough and would struggle to fit two vehicles on it next to each other. It should be changed to one single lane to enter the roundabout from all junctions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded and worn road line, 21st December
item.description:
The centre road lines are worn and faded along with the give way lines at the junction of Stella Way
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Irish Butts Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severely faded road lines, 21st December
item.description:
The painted centre road lines and other markings here are so severely worn that they have disappeared altogether in parts. In desperate need of repainting. Effected areas: - The stretch of Innsworth Lane all the way from Little Normans to Chaffinch Close - And the give way markings at the exit of Innsworth Industrial Park and also the ones exiting from Rookery Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit 15a Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another hole marked for repair unfixed., 21st December
item.description:
As per other hole. This hole has been here for ages. Months ago it was marked for repair but hasn't been repaired. It's been so long the white paint has nearly gone. I've reported this previously but it gets closed as "repaired" . It isn't repaired, See attached photo,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 Prestbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This hole has been here for ages. Months ago it was marked for repair but hasn't been repaired. It's been so long the white paint has nearly gone. I've reported this previously but it gets closed as "repaired" . It isn't repaired, See attached photo,
